request_pathways.name: WWMG Medical Records Release Form (fillable PDF)
Fax submission (per OFFICE USE ONLY disposition options)

forms.document_type: Generic ROI authorization form (unbranded, legacy PatientPop artifact)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a general-purpose fillable authorization PDF and select 'Personal (to patient)' as the purpose, then submit via fax, mail, or email.

red_flags: Vague fee language ('*service fee may apply') for patient self-access without specifying amounts or referencing HIPAA cost-based limits
'ALL healthcare information' option is silently limited to last 3 years — misleading scope label
bright_spots: 39 fillable interactive PDF fields — genuinely digital-first form design
Single-page format fitting all necessary authorization elements concisely
Granular sensitive-information exclusion controls (HIV, STDs, psychiatric, substance abuse) with required patient initials
Multi-clinic routing field acknowledging organizational complexity

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation or a simple search — WWMG maintains a dedicated Medical Records Request page with direct PDF links, and site-specific search returns the form immediately.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the form has 39 fillable fields for complete digital completion, but submission requires fax, mail, or email rather than an integrated online workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — single-page layout with logical flow, plain language, and strong scope options, but submission instructions are indirect (requires visiting a separate webpage) and the 'ALL' scope label is misleading.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form is a generic third-party release authorization where patients must select 'Personal (to patient)' as one checkbox among attorney, insurance, and provider purposes, with no dedicated patient access pathway or rights education.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization or in-person requirements, anti-conditioning statement present, but vague '*service fee may apply' language for patient access and no specific right-of-access citation.

overall.summary: WWMG provides a technically well-crafted, easy-to-find fillable authorization form, but funnels patients through a generic third-party release process rather than offering a dedicated patient access pathway.
